tips.title: Quick File Navigation
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+P` to quickly search and open files in your workspace. Start typing the filename to filter the list.

tips.title: Command Palette
tips.content: Access all VS Code commands with `Ctrl+Shift+P` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+P` (macOS). This is your gateway to everything VS Code can do!

tips.title: Multi-Cursor Editing
tips.content: Hold `Alt` (`Option` on macOS) and click to add multiple cursors. Edit multiple lines simultaneously!

tips.title: Zen Mode
tips.content: Toggle distraction-free coding with `Ctrl+K Z`. Press `Esc` twice to exit.

tips.title: Integrated Terminal
tips.content: Toggle the integrated terminal with `` Ctrl+` `` (backtick). Keep coding and running commands without switching windows.

tips.title: Smart Selection
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+D` to select the next occurrence of the current selection. Great for renaming variables or making multiple similar changes!

tips.title: Split Editor Views
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+\` to split the editor into multiple panes. Perfect for viewing different parts of the same file or comparing files side by side.

tips.title: Search Across Files
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+Shift+F` to search across all files in your workspace. Perfect for finding specific code or text patterns.

tips.title: Quick File Creation
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+N` for a new untitled file. Add multiple files quickly without leaving your keyboard.

tips.title: IntelliSense Everywhere
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+Space` anywhere to manually trigger IntelliSense suggestions. Works in code, settings, and even JSON files!
